definition: medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison

pinyin: gao1 neng2 lie4 xing4 zha4 yao4

sentences.english: The first thing he asked me was to help him get some dynamite, so that he could blow up Kim Jong Il.
sentences.chinese: 他對我提的第一個要求就是幫他搞到一些炸藥。

sentences.english: The explosion blew the window open.
The government says a suspect arrested last month, Najibullah Zazi, traveled to Pakistan last year to train in weapons and explosives.
sentences.chinese: 該名嫌犯曾於去年在巴基斯坦進行武器和炸藥的培訓。

sentences.english: The combustion is an important index of coal mine permissible explosive.
sentences.chinese: 爆燃性是煤礦炸藥的一個重要安全指標。

sentences.english: Man wanted to work in dynamite factory.
All the cartridges having been made, and all the powder used, this table was free.
sentences.chinese: 子彈做好及炸藥用完之後，現在桌子是空着的。

sentences.english: The residents of Kiev didn’t even know they lived on a “powder keg”.
sentences.chinese: 基輔的居民並不知道他們正住在“炸藥桶”上。

sentences.english: The bombers had packed aluminium powder around the explosives to accelerate the fire.
sentences.chinese: 爆炸者在炸藥中添充了鋁粉，其加速了大火的燃燒。

sentences.english: and put bomb craters in there.
Solidification degree of PETN composite explosive would affect ultrasonic attenuation.
sentences.chinese: 介紹泰安混合炸藥固化程度對超聲波衰減的影響。

sentences.english: It is possible to use Gurit without damaging the surrounding rock.
sentences.chinese: 使用古力特炸藥將完全可能不造成對圍巖的破壞。

sentences.english: (KNO3) used especially as a fertilizer and explosive.
He bought some home-made explosives from the street traders.
sentences.chinese: 商販那兒買了一些土製炸藥。

sentences.english: She says the soldiers have found some gelignite in the canal at the end of your back garden.
sentences.chinese: 她說士兵們在你家後院的河裏發現了一些炸藥。

sentences.english: OBD:I cannae go any faster, lad, these explosives be delicate.
sentences.chinese: 俺沒法再快了，小子，這些炸藥很嬌貴。

sentences.english: They blew the door off with a small charge of high explosive.
sentences.chinese: 他們裝了一小包烈性炸藥把門炸掉了。

definition: also written 機槍|机枪/machine gun
to ignite/to light a fire/to agitate/to start an engine/ignition/fig. to stir up trouble
